title: Venus and Serena Williams' coach: "We changed history"
description: Champion tennis coach Rick Macci shares the moment he first saw the sisters play.

title: The sudden silencing of Guantanamo's artists
description: A Trump administration policy barred art from leaving Guantanamo. The artists are fighting to reverse it.

title: The female stonemason saving a little piece of history
description: Alice Eaton is working to restore Haddon Hall, a 16th Century stately home frequently used in films.

title: Charli XCX: I was always up for getting down and dirty
description: Looking back at her career from illegal raves to stadium tours, the star wonders what will come next.

title: FedEx Cup: Rory McIlroy beats Scottie Scheffler & Sungjae Im by one stroke
description: Northern Ireland's Rory McIlroy beats Scottie Scheffler and Sungjae Im by one shot on a remarkable day to win his third FedEx Cup.

title: Match of the Day 2: Micah Richards on Saint-Maximin's 'outstanding' volley
description: Match of the Day 2's Micah Richards and Ashley Williams discuss how Wolves frustrated Newcastle's Allan Saint-Maximin for much of their 1-1 draw - but could do nothing about his equaliser.

title: Store closures at lowest level for seven years
description: Betting shops and banks are in decline but the restaurant sector is growing, new data suggests.

title: The Palestinians facing mass eviction in the West Bank
description: Fears mount among more than 1,000 Palestinians that Israel’s army will force them to leave their homes in the occupied West Bank.

title: Williams' goodbye and Raducanu's defence top US Open bill
description: Serena Williams' impending farewell and Emma Raducanu's title defence will grab most of the attention at an intriguing US Open packed with storylines.

title: Pakistan flood victims throw note pleading for help
description: The BBC meets stranded residents of one mountain valley as monster floods swamp parts of the country.

title: Bike protest takes over German motorway
description: The demonstrators are calling for more environmentally friendly transport options.

title: Antony: Manchester United agree £80m deal for Ajax winger
description: Manchester United agree an £80m deal with Ajax for Brazil winger Antony.

title: Notting Hill Carnival returns: 'Everything about it is beautiful'
description: Carnival-goers delighted as Europe's largest street party is back after three years.

title: In pictures: Thousands enjoy Reading Festival 2022
description: Ed Sheeran surprised the crowd at this year's event, joining Bring Me the Horizon on stage.

title: Taiwan: Two US warships sail through strait
description: It is the first US operation in the strait since China held large-scale military drills in the area.

title: Pakistan floods: Appeals for aid as 119 more die in a day
description: More than 1,000 people have died since monsoons began in June, with new floods this week.

title: Big Bash League draft: Liam Livingstone first pick in inaugural draft
description: Melbourne Renegades select England all-rounder Liam Livingstone, while Sam Billings, Chris Jordan and David Willey are also signed.

title: Energy bills: Liz Truss 'rules out' more direct help for all
description: The Tory leadership contender is considering other options such as tax cuts, her teams says.

title: Pakistan floods: Bed frames used to pull victims over rushing water
description: Several people are brought to safety by volunteer helpers in Swat, northern Pakistan.

title: Talks continue in bid to end bin strikes
description: Unions want a "flat cash pay offer" where everybody would receive the same amount of money.

title: Ukraine war: Russian recruitment drive unlikely to have impact - UK
description: Vladimir Putin recently pledged to increase Russia's armed forces personnel by 137,000.

title: England v South Africa: Maturing England produce their best performance of summer
description: England have pulled off some stunning victories this summer, but the mauling of South Africa was their best so far, says chief cricket writer Stephan Shemilt.

title: Kayaker Nick Ray: I'll paddle off to sea and not come back for a year
description: Kayaker and mental health advocate Nick Ray is heading on a year-long journey into the wilderness.

title: California freeway split in half by monsoon floods
description: Aerial footage shows the destroyed section of Interstate 10 near the Arizona-California border.

title: Port of Felixstowe strike workers enter final day
description: Almost 2,000 workers enter an eighth and final day of industrial action at the Port of Felixstowe.

title: TikTok: Welsh young people quitting their jobs for social media
description: Young people spend more time on TikTok in Wales than the rest of the UK, so why is it so popular?

title: Belfast: The hidden castles under the city's shops
description: The remains of three castles dating from the 13th Century could lie beneath the city, archaeologists say.

title: Newspaper headlines: 'Wave of strikes' and Truss 'mulls 5% VAT cut'
description: Union plans for coordinated industrial action and proposals for a 'nuclear' reduction in VAT lead the papers.

title: Leeds Festival: Dave raps with fan while making history
description: The Londoner rapped on stage with a fan again as he became the youngest star to headline the event.

title: Three parents on the 'black hole' of child suicide
description: Parents discuss the biggest killer of young people, and the importance of talking.

title: Edinburgh Fringe: Satirists bid farewell to Boris Johnson
description: As Boris Johnson prepares to leave office, satirists reflect on what it's like portraying the PM.

title: Three off-duty Dutch commandos shot outside hotel in Indianapolis
description: Police say the soldiers, who were in the US for training, were found with gunshot wounds early on Saturday.

title: Tony Hudgell: Release of birth father halted under new law on offenders
description: Anthony Smith tortured his baby son so badly the boy required a double leg amputation.

title: Climate change: Avocados and exotic plants grow in hot UK summer
description: Gardeners say that warmer weather is boosting the growth of figs, watermelon and other exotic plants.
